marklogic.body: I think you're totally right about Megan as threat, requiring punishment or taming because she gets out of line. I think an interesting side of this too is the way that Don's emasculation is also played out in terms of visibility. Whereas he's Always the man behind the "image", the brains behind the construction of ad campaigns/posters/commercials etc, here he becomes subject to the gaze of his supposedly social inferiors (his employees, "queers", stoned sailors!). Can't help but think of Joan's comment about how "handsome" DD must have been when he Blushed....
